interaction_summary:
=== Purchase Information ===
Product Title: The Italian Job [Blu-ray]
Review Date: 2009/01/08
Store: Donald Sutherland  (Actor),     Mark Wahlberg  (Actor),     F. Gary Gray  (Director)    &                   0                  more   Rated:    PG-13    Format: Blu-ray
Categories: Movies & TV, Featured Categories, Blu-ray, Action & Adventure
Product Description: ['The plan was flawless. The execution was perfect. Charlie Croker pulled off the crime of a lifetime. The one thing that he didn\'t plan on was being double-crossed. Now he wants more than the job\'s payoff... he wants payback. Mark Wahlberg is electrifying as Croker in this "fast and furious action-adventure." Along with a drop-dead gorgeous safecracker (Charlize Theron), Croker and his team take off to re-steal the loot and end up in a pulse-pounding, pedal-to-the-metal chase that careens up, down and below the streets of Los Angeles. With an ensemble all-star cast that also includes Edward Norton, Seth Green, Jason Statham, Mos Def, Franky G and Donald Sutherland, the Italian Job is hot!']
Average Rating: 4.7
Product Details: {'Genre': 'Action & Adventure', 'Format': "NTSC, Special Edition, Collector's Edition, Subtitled, Color, Multiple Formats, Blu-ray, Dolby, DTS Surround Sound, WidescreenNTSC, Special Edition, Collector's Edition, Subtitled, Color, Multiple Formats, Blu-ray, Dolby, DTS Surround Sound, Widescreen   See more", 'Contributor': 'F. Gary Gray, Tiberio Greco, Stefano Petronelli, Jason Statham, Seth Green, Donald Sutherland, Mark Wahlberg, Wayne Powers, Fabio Scarpa, Fausto Callegarini, Troy Kennedy-Martin, Donna Powers, Mos Def, Edward Norton, Cristiano Bonora, Charlize TheronF. Gary Gray, Tiberio Greco, Stefano Petronelli, Jason Statham, Seth Green, Donald Sutherland, Mark Wahlberg, Wayne Powers, Fabio Scarpa, Fausto Callegarini, Troy Kennedy-Martin, Donna Powers, Mos Def, Edward Norton, Cristiano Bonora, Charlize Theron   See more', 'Language': 'English', 'Runtime': '1 hour and 51 minutes', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'PG-13 (Parents Strongly Cautioned)', 'Product Dimensions': '0.7 x 7.5 x 5.4 inches; 5.92 Ounces', 'Item model number': '118314', 'Director': 'F. Gary Gray', 'Media Format': "Blu-ray, Multiple Formats, Special Edition, Widescreen, DTS Surround Sound, NTSC, Dolby, Collector's Edition, Color, Subtitled", 'Run time': '1 hour and 51 minutes', 'Release date': 'June 3, 2008', 'Actors': 'Donald Sutherland, Mark Wahlberg, Edward Norton, Charlize Theron, Jason Statham', 'Subtitles': 'Spanish, French, English', 'Studio': 'Paramount', 'Writers': 'Donna Powers, Troy Kennedy-Martin, Wayne Powers', 'Country of Origin': 'USA', 'Number of discs': '1'}
Review Text: We have a top of the line Sony 52" XBR TV and Sony Blu-Ray player we purchased for Christmas and I purchased the Blu-ray version of this movie because we enjoy the movie so much.  It wasn't worth it!  It has trouble rewriting quickly during the action scenes.  We actually compared it to the regular DVD that we own and to be honest... it isn't worth the additional expense to purchase the Blu-ray.  Overall, we have noticed that with all of the older movies that have been converted to Blu-ray... they tend to be a disappointment in the blu-ray version for the same rewriting problems.  However, animations are incredible and all of the new movies that have recently been released in the theaters that are just coming out on Blu-Ray are great... like Ironman... that one was incredible on Blu-ray.
Review Title: Movie is great... Blu-Ray is terrible
Rating: 1.0
--------------------------------------------------

We have a top of the line Sony 52" XBR TV and Sony Blu-Ray player we purchased for Christmas and I purchased the Blu-ray version of this movie because we enjoy the movie so much.  It wasn't worth it!  It has trouble rewriting quickly during the action scenes.  We actually compared it to the regular DVD that we own and to be honest... it isn't worth the additional expense to purchase the Blu-ray.  Overall, we have noticed that with all of the older movies that have been converted to Blu-ray... they tend to be a disappointment in the blu-ray version for the same rewriting problems.  However, animations are incredible and all of the new movies that have recently been released in the theaters that are just coming out on Blu-Ray are great... like Ironman... that one was incredible on Blu-ray.
Movie is great... Blu-Ray is terrible
profile:
**User Preferences Summary:**

- **Movie Genre Preference:** Strong inclination towards action and adventure films, particularly those featuring well-known actors and engaging plots.
- **Actor Affinity:** Favors performers like Mark Wahlberg, Charlize Theron, and Edward Norton, suggesting a preference for star-studded casts.
- **Format Feedback:** Exhibits a significant skepticism towards Blu-ray conversions of older films, expressing disappointment over quality issues compared to standard DVDs. However, appreciates the superior quality of newer animated films on Blu-ray.
- **Viewing Equipment:** Owns high-quality entertainment equipment, indicating a serious interest in the home viewing experience.
- **Critical Reviewer:** Provides detailed critiques based on firsthand experiences and maintains an analytical approach to evaluating movie formats.

This user appears to appreciate engaging, well-executed films but has reservations about the Blu-ray format for classic titles, suggesting past experiences have shaped a cautious approach to purchasing older movies in this format.
